questions.question: The electronic configurations of the atoms of two elements X and Y are 2,8, 1 and 2, 8,7 respectively. Of the following statements about the pair of those elements, which statement is false?
answers: located in the same period in the Periodic Table
located in the same group in the Periodic Table
combine and form the compound with the chemical formula XY
questions.correct_answer: located in the same group in the Periodic Table

questions.question: Consider the following statements presented regarding natural rubber.  A - It is a linear polymer. B - Isoprene is the monomer C - There are cross links among the chains Of these statements
answers: only A and B are true
only B and C are true
only A and C are true
questions.correct_answer: only A and B are true

questions.question: A 4N force and a 3 N force are applied on an object at the same instance. Consider the following statements given about the magnitude of the resultant obtainable at that occasion. A - The maximum magnitude of the resultant obtainable is 7 N. B - The minimum magnitude of the resultant obtainable is 1 N. C - The magnitude of the resultant obtainable is always 5 N. Of the above, the correct statement(s) is / are
Consider the following statements. A - Biomagnification occurs along a food chain. B - Toxic chemical pollutants concentrate more in the upper trophic levels of a food chain. Of the above statements,
answers: both A and B are true
A is true while B is false
A is false while B is true
both A and B are false
questions.correct_answer: both A and B are true

questions.question: A statement displayed on aboard near a tank is 'It is you who turned the water in this tank green'. Which of the following human activities in connection with the tank would have contributed most to the change mentioned on the board?
answers: clearing the area above the tank
increase in algae population due to fishing
accumulation of oil and grease due to vehicle wash
addition of faecal and excretory matter to the water
questions.correct_answer: addition of faecal and excretory matter to the water
